column4: i'm on ubuntu and i have the kubuntu cd added to the repository list and i started installing the kubuntu-desktop package through synaptic but unfortunately it starts downloading packages from the internet. i cancelled. what do i do to make it install the kubuntu packages from cd? someone help please. :)
anyone?
temporarily disable the online repos in synaptic
all of them?
only the online ones. You need the CD ones enabled, of course.
now there IS no option for kubuntu-desktop in synaptic
then you haven't got the required packages on the CD.
its the original kubuntu cd
then you've probably disabled the CD repo.
when i only leave the cd repo enabled, then only the ALREADY installed packages appear
have you done an update (click the "Reload" button)
yes
then I don't know, sorry.
thanks
were you able to solve your repos problem?
not quite. but i installed the kubuntu-desktop successfully from the internet
well done... you could have saved some download time by manually copying .deb files from the CD to the package cache.
sorry, too late now.
indeed. i'm trying to discover the kde environment on ubuntu. not bad, actually.. still looking around :-)
did you know that there's a #kubuntu channel?
yes i do, but back when i posted my problem there, nobody was able to help so I had to post here
